means: 使离间(estrange的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Renata wrote him that she had encountered her long-estranged father.
sentence.Network_cn: 雷娜塔写信告诉他说她碰到了分离多年的父亲。

sentence.Network_en: Arran became increasingly estranged from the mainstream of Hollywood.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿伦变得越来越脱离好莱坞的主流了。

sentence.Network_en: Joanna, 30, spent most of her twenties virtually estranged from her father.
sentence.Network_cn: 30岁的乔安娜在她二十几岁的时候大多数时间根本不和父亲来往。

He has consistently denied murdering his estranged wife ., 他自始至终否认谋杀了分居的妻子.
殊异(the estranged)(洪凌,1995:42).表面上看来,李威有许多「金蝉脱壳」的蜕变契机,但是他都无法清楚地掌握,因此他在忍受严重压力 …
She permitted her son to visit her estranged husband ., 她允许她的儿子去看望她分居的丈夫.

encyclopedia.content: 《Estranged》是美国硬摇滚乐队枪炮与玫瑰(Guns N Roses)的一支单曲，收录于他们的第四张专辑《Use YourIllusion II》

entry.def: An estranged wife or husband is no longer living with their husband or wife.

entry.tran: （因与亲朋发生争吵而）疏远的，不和的，不来往的
entry.def: If you are estranged from your family or friends, you have quarrelled with them and are not communicating with them.

example.ex: He was laid to rest yesterday without a final goodbye from his estranged son...
example.tran: 他昨天去世了，关系疏远的儿子没来作最后的道别。

example.ex: Joanna, 30, spent most of her twenties virtually estranged from her father.
example.tran: 30岁的乔安娜在她二十几岁的时候大多数时间根本不和父亲来往。

entry.tran: （与社团、职业等）疏离的，疏远的，脱离的
entry.def: If you describe someone as estranged from something such as society or their profession, you mean that they no longer seem involved in it.

example.ex: Arran became increasingly estranged from the mainstream of Hollywood.
example.tran: 阿伦变得越来越脱离好莱坞的主流了。

auth_sentence.content: But there was no sign of his estranged wife.
auth_sentence.res_content: But there was no sign of his estranged wife.

auth_sentence.res_content: Young women called to turn in their estranged boyfriends.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Young women called to turn in their estranged boyfriends.
